page.title: 20LOCAL PERSONALITIES
page.content: {Mr. Albert Platt},10 Weston Lane, Shavington spent 32 years in Local Government at Parish and Borough level. He became Mayor of Crewe & Nantwich in 1978. In his official year he attended a garden party at Buckingham Palace, visited Belgium with Crewe "It's a Knockout" team and also Crewe's twin town, Macon, France. {Mr. Sam Henshall}, Shavington Lodge, Weston Lane, was a slaughterer, wholesale and retail butcher for nearly 50 years (first with father and later on his own). The shop on Nantwich Road, Crewe (now sold) still bears his name. He retired to breed pedigree cattle. From two, he produced a prize-winning herd of 30 beasts, known as "The Lodge Herd" of British Simmenthals. One cow alone has produced 4 bulls selling for a total of Â£13,500.
